Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush is focused on communications, where most other coins are focused on financial transactions. We like both

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ZER devs seem pretty cool, but I don't know a lot about their recent work

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If people value privacy more in the future, Hush is a store-of-privacy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> That is how it will have value. If people don't value privacy, it won't have value

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Same goes for ARRR

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Also, this is not financial advice, just ramblings from Duke

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <halo kitty rules> ARRR is a good coin, but expensive at the moment. HUSH will very likely rise again, as it is expected the messenger could be widely used. Also wallet with by default shielded addresses should accelerate using of z-addr. As far sa I know ZER is still GPU mined, but has ZEC vulnerability. Infinite supply of coins can be secretly generated.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so yes, Hush is cheaper to buy that Pirate right now, but Pirate is still more profitable to mine currently

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> Is there any easy to access WIF to WIF converter anywhere except on verus agama?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @heguli97 i don't know of any other GUI for it, we have a gh issue to be able to import old-style keys directly into SD: https://github.com/MyHush/SilentDragon/issues/16

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's definitely something that I would like to add to SilentDragon

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> are you wanting to convert an old Hush v2 WIF to the new style ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I could write a Python script for it, but that doesn't help most people

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> I'm just thinking of a simple way for people to do it, at moment the option for most people is to download verus agama, not very intuitive if they want to use hushmate for example.  @dukeleto

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @heguli97 i agree with you that it's a really non-optimal solution currently. The other way is to use an old wallet.dat with -zawpwallettxes, but that is also not super user-friendly

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we need GUI support for this stuff, but GUI code takes a lot of time. At least for me, I am still learning a lot about QT5, which SilentDragon uses. Talking to the backend hushd is very easy for me, but rendering a button or window a certain way, oh boy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> hey is it possible to fork verge?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Moeen possible to fork anything

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> can you give me some information?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> if I fork for example verge

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> after that what are the requirements

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @heguli97 ideally, all wallets should be able to use an old wallet.dat, start with -zapwallettxes, but it's not user friendly, what "should happen"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> what should happen is all funds are swept out of that old wallet.dat, to a new wallet.dat

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's not good to use an old wallet.dat from hush v2 on the new v3 chain, indefinitely

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> -zapwallettxes is a hack all the way from BTC. BTC core people wrote that so they could claim funds on fork coins easily

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you use old wallets, I have found, weird stuff happens. So you really must sweep funds out of it. That makes the whole process a little annoying to automate, for people and computers

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Moeen i am not sure what your programming background is and I am not sure forking Verge talk is appropriate for this channel. I am also having a hard time thinking of where else you can go. #developers channel or #dev-general in KMD discord perhaps. The more important question is: Why do you want to fork Verge?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I don't actually know much about Verge, take anything I say with appropriate bags of salt

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> anyway how much does it cost?  @dukeleto

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> @dukeleto??

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Moeen i am not sure what "it" refers to

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> fork a coin and a block chain @dukeleto

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> @dukeleto approximately

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> No idea. Monetary cost is the least of the problem

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> tell me

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> for the least one

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Moeen> minimum

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> might as well ask "How much does it cost to start a business?"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It's a nonsense question with no answer

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Finding people with the skills to do it is problem #1, not monetary costs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Cost of the human skills to operate it is 100X or more of physical cost of servers/etc
